title: 27-year-old victim in Treme multiple shooting has died, NOPD says
content:
A 27-year-old who was among four people shot Friday (June 5) in the 2100 block of Gov. Nicholls Street in Treme has died, New Orleans police said.
The other victims, who are 15, 19, and 21, are recovering from their injuries, police said.
Authorities also were investigating a shooting on North Roman near LaHarpe Street - about six blocks away -- that occurred around the same time. Police said a 29-year-old man was shot in the leg, and his injury was not life-threatening.
The shootings happened around 2:15 p.m., police said.
Investigators said they were looking for two gunmen in a red Nissan Versa with an out-of-state license plate that possibly was missing its passenger-side mirror.
Police have not made any arrests or determined a motive for the shooting.
The Versa last was seen traveling from the North Roman shooting scene down LaHarpe toward Galvez Street, investigators said Friday.
In both shootings, the victims were outside, either on the street or sidewalk, when they were shot, NOPD 1st District Commander Otha Sandifer said.
Police have asked anyone with information about the shootings to call 1st District Detective Kevin Richardson at 504.658.6010 or Crimestoppers at 504.822.1111.
This story has been updated with new information from NOPD to correct the age of the victim who died.
